disruption.documentation: Description of physics quantities of specific interest during a disruption, in particular halo currents, etc ...

disruption.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

disruption.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

disruption.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

disruption.global_quantities.current_hal.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "current_halo_pol"
Index in the error_description list for "current_halo_tor"

disruption.global_quantities.energy_ohm.documentation: Total ohmic cumulated energy (integral of the power over the disruption duration)

disruption.global_quantities.energy_ohm_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "energy_ohm"
Ohmic cumulated energy (integral of the power over the disruption duration) in the halo region
Index in the error_description list for "energy_ohm_halo"

disruption.global_quantities.energy_radi.documentation: Total cumulated energy (integral of the power over the disruption duration) radiated by electrons on impurities
Index in the error_description list for "energy_radiated_electrons_impurities"
Cumulated energy (integral of the power over the disruption duration) radiated by electrons on impurities in the halo region
Index in the error_description list for "energy_radiated_electrons_impurities_halo"

disruption.global_quantities.power_ohm_e.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "power_ohm"

disruption.global_quantities.power_ohm_h.documentation: Ohmic power in the halo region
Index in the error_description list for "power_ohm_halo"

disruption.global_quantities.power_radia.documentation: Total power radiated by electrons on impurities
Index in the error_description list for "power_radiated_electrons_impurities"
Power radiated by electrons on impurities in the halo region
Index in the error_description list for "power_radiated_electrons_impurities_halo"

disruption.halo_currents.documentation: Halo currents geometry and values for a set of time slices

disruption.halo_currents[:].active_wall_.documentation: R,Z position of the point of the plasma boundary in contact with the wall
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

disruption.halo_currents[:].area.documentation: Set of wall areas through which there are halo currents

disruption.halo_currents[:].area[:].curr.documentation: Poloidal halo current crossing through this area
Index in the error_description list for "current_halo_pol"

disruption.halo_currents[:].area[:].end_.documentation: Position of the end point of this area
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

disruption.halo_currents[:].area[:].star.documentation: Position of the start point of this area
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

disruption.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

disruption.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

disruption.ids_properties.creation_date.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

disruption.ids_properties.homogeneous_ti.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0, 1, or 2) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, homogeneous_time must be set to 2

disruption.ids_properties.occurrence.description: occurrence number [NOTE: this field only exists in OMAS and is not part of the ITER PDM]

disruption.ids_properties.provider.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

disruption.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...)

disruption.ids_properties.version_put.documentation: Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS

disruption.ids_properties.version_put.ac.documentation: Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS

disruption.ids_properties.version_put.da.documentation: Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS

disruption.profiles_1d.documentation: Radial profiles for a set of time slices

disruption.profiles_1d[:].grid.area.documentation: Cross-sectional area of the flux surface

disruption.profiles_1d[:].grid.area_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "area"

disruption.profiles_1d[:].grid.psi_bound.documentation: Value of the poloidal magnetic flux at the plasma boundary (useful to normalize the psi array values when the radial grid doesn't go from the magnetic axis to the plasma boundary)
Index in the error_description list for "psi_boundary"

disruption.profiles_1d[:].grid.psi_error.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "psi"

disruption.profiles_1d[:].grid.psi_magne.documentation: Value of the poloidal magnetic flux at the magnetic axis (useful to normalize the psi array values when the radial grid doesn't go from the magnetic axis to the plasma boundary)
Index in the error_description list for "psi_magnetic_axis"

disruption.profiles_1d[:].grid.rho_pol_n.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "rho_pol_norm"

disruption.profiles_1d[:].grid.rho_tor.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate. rho_tor = sqrt(b_flux_tor/(pi*b0)) ~ sqrt(pi*r^2*b0/(pi*b0)) ~ r [m]. The toroidal field used in its definition is indicated under vacuum_toroidal_field/b0

disruption.profiles_1d[:].grid.rho_tor_e.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "rho_tor"

disruption.profiles_1d[:].grid.rho_tor_n.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate. The normalizing value for rho_tor_norm, is the toroidal flux coordinate at the equilibrium boundary (LCFS or 99.x % of the LCFS in case of a fixed boundary equilibium calculation, see time_slice/boundary/b_flux_pol_norm in the equilibrium IDS)
Index in the error_description list for "rho_tor_norm"

disruption.profiles_1d[:].grid.volume.documentation: Volume enclosed inside the magnetic surface

disruption.profiles_1d[:].grid.volume_er.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "volume"

disruption.profiles_1d[:].j_runaways.documentation: Runaways parallel current density = average(j.B) / B0, where B0 = Disruption/Vacuum_Toroidal_Field/ B0

disruption.profiles_1d[:].j_runaways_err.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "j_runaways"

disruption.profiles_1d[:].power_density_.documentation: Power density of conductive losses to the wall (positive sign for losses)
Index in the error_description list for "power_density_conductive_losses"
Power density of radiative losses (positive sign for losses)
Index in the error_description list for "power_density_radiative_losses"

disruption.vacuum_toroidal_field.documentation: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field (used in rho_tor definition and in the normalization of current densities)

disruption.vacuum_toroidal_field.b0.documentation: Vacuum toroidal field at R0 [T]; Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewing from above. The product R0B0 must be consistent with the b_tor_vacuum_r field of the tf IDS.

disruption.vacuum_toroidal_field.b0_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "b0"

disruption.vacuum_toroidal_field.r0.documentation: Reference major radius where the vacuum toroidal magnetic field is given (usually a fixed position such as the middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane)

disruption.vacuum_toroidal_field.r0_erro.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "r0"
